title.narrative: 4.4 PUBLIC PROGS & INVESTEMENT IN CHILDREN

description.narrative: CSOs have tools and mechanisms to access data and information about programmes and investments in children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents who face multiple deprivations have increased access to pertinent, effective and integrated social protection system taht are properly funded, monitored and evaluated

title.narrative: CSOs have tools and mechanisms to access data and information about programmes and investments in children

description.narrative: In 2021, the CO strengthened existing and established new strategic partnerships with civil society organizations (CSOs) and private foundations to develop and publish new information and data-driven analysis regarding public policies and the situation of children in El Salvador. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2022
